page.title: 10Abbots Langley life.
page.content: We went to see Mr Flanagan to interview him. He lives in Abbots Langley and used to teach at Holy Rood school. He has lived there for over 30 years. He told us that the land had belonged to an Abbot and was the birthplace of the only English Pope. It is a large village and is surrounded by open land. There are a few factories and some farms. Most of the population go to work in Watford or London. There is a peaceful feeling in the place. It is a friendly community still and many young people know each other. There are quite a few retired people about. There are amenities for young and old but some people don't bother going. It is a pleasant place to live in but things are changing as the new M25 Motorway being built nearby and this has brought more traffic and noise.
